intro: Brickellia hebecarpoides, commonly known as the narrow-fruit brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and the flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Brickellia hebecarpoides is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
